acknowledgments.summary: Amine Amri, Stanislav Dashevskyi, and Daniel dos Santos from Forescout, and Asaf Karas and Shachar Menashe from VDOO reported these vulnerabilities to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities may result in unauthorized access to arbitrary information, DNS cache poisoning, remote code execution, or a denial-of-service condition.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Multiple
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: COUNTRIES/AREAS DEPLOYED: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: COMPANY HEADQUARTERS LOCATION: Hungary
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-21-217-01 - Web Scraped Version

document.title: HCC Embedded InterNiche TCP/IP stack, NicheLite (Update B)

cwe.name: Return of Pointer Value Outside of Expected Range

notes.text: When parsing DNS domain names, there are no checks on whether a domain name compression pointer is pointing within the bounds of the packet, which may result in an out-of-bounds read.CVE-2020-25767 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency

notes.text: The routine for parsing DNS response packets does not check the “response data length” field of individual DNS answers, which may cause an out-of-bounds read/write.CVE-2020-25928 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency

notes.text: The number of queries or responses specified in the DNS packet header is not validated with the query/response data available in the DNS packet, leading to an out-of-bounds read.CVE-2020-25927 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: The DNS client does not sufficiently randomize transaction IDs, facilitating DNS cache poisoning attacks.CVE-2020-25926 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.0 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: The code that parses ICMP packets relies on an unchecked value of the IP payload size to compute the ICMP checksum, which may result in an out-of-bounds read.CVE-2020-35683 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: The code that parses TCP packets relies on an unchecked value of the IP payload size to compute the length of the TCP payload within the TCP checksum computation function, which may result in an out-of-bounds read.CVE-2020-35684 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: TCP ISNs are insufficiently randomized, which may result in TCP spoofing by an attacker.CVE-2020-35685 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: The TCP urgent data processing function may invoke a panic function, which may result in an infinite loop.CVE-2021-31400 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: An attacker could send a specially crafted IP packet to trigger an integer overflow due to the lack of IP length validation.CVE-2021-31401 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: A potential heap buffer overflow exists in the code that parses the HTTP POST request due to lack of size validation.CVE-2021-31226 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

cwe.name: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check

notes.text: A potential heap buffer overflow exists in the code that parses the HTTP POST request due to an incorrect signed integer comparison.CVE-2021-31227 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

cwe.name: Generation of Predictable Numbers or Identifiers

notes.text: An attacker may be able to predict DNS queries’ source port to then send forged DNS response packets, which may be accepted as valid answers.CVE-2021-31228 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.0 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

cwe.name: Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions

notes.text: Unhandled HTTP requests result in an infinite loop that disrupts TCP/IP communication.CVE-2021-27565 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HCC recommends users apply release v4.3 or later to mitigate these vulnerabilities. For more information, contact HCC.
Additional vendors affected by the reported vulnerabilities have also released security advisories related to their affected products. Those advisories are as follows:

notes.text: The TFTP packet processing function does not ensure that the filename is null-terminated, which may result in a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2021-36762 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
